page.title: 15Attitudes.
page.content: There is a strong feeling among the people for tradition in their ways and beleifs. Perhaps the overriding influence of nature on their work has developed an inbred conservatism. Change comes slowly. Newcomers to the area are received with politeness and friendliness, but they must work quite an appreniiceship before being considered as " one of them". This is particularly applicable to the newly arrived retired people who in many cases are of high professional standing and who can bring their knowledge and organisational powers to the improvement of the community. There influx and and influence has without doubt stimulated the formation of many desirable educational societies and working parties. An example of this can be see in local efforts to
